page.title: 16Coolham/Shipley Development
page.content: While the area has so far resisted development, retaining its essentially rural character, it is none the less experiencing a change in social emphasis. Being in the S.E. and close to Gatwick Airport housing costs are very high - Â£55,000 (3 bed semi) to Â£150,000+ (large detached). Although there is resistance by the local authorities to developing agricultural land, many farms have amalgamated or been sold. Redundant farmhouses and tied cottages have been privately purchased. The cost of housing coupled with limited employment and public transport prevents younger families with children from moving into the area to regenerate the population. Many properties have been greatly extended and their value further increased by the addition of tennis courts, swimming pools, etc....
